intro: Oxalis rhombeo-ovata subsp. sustenta, commonly known as the Cape iron cross, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It features distinctive, shield-shaped leaves with a deep green color and a prominent central vein. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers with five petals, typically in spring. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil. Oxalis rhombeo-ovata subsp. sustenta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
